questions.question: Someone jumps out and yells “BOO!” right behind you. You:
choices: Scream and nearly hit the ceiling
Flinch hard but recover in 1 second

questions.question: A car horn blares out of nowhere. Your body reacts:
Your friends throw you a surprise party. The moment the lights flip on and everyone yells, you:
choices: Scream, drop whatever you’re holding, then laugh
Knew the whole time and pretend to be shocked

questions.question: A loud balloon pops right next to you. Instant reaction:
choices: Jump out of your skin and curse
Laugh because you popped it on purpose

questions.question: Watching a jump-scare horror movie, you usually:
choices: Scream every single time (even when you know it’s coming)
Jump a little but stay seated

questions.question: Someone tosses you their keys without warning. You:
choices: Fumble and drop them half the time
Catch them smoothly 90% of the time
Duck first, then pick them up off the floor

questions.question: Thunder cracks super loud while you’re outside. You:
choices: Quick flinch then laugh at yourself

questions.question: A spider drops from the ceiling onto your desk. Your move:
choices: Leap backward, chair flies, possible scream
Slowly stand up and walk away
Pick it up and relocate it

questions.question: Your phone on max volume rings in a dead-silent room. You:
choices: Nearly throw the phone across the room
Knew it was about to ring

questions.question: In general, people who know you would say your startle reflex is:
choices: Legendary—everyone tries to scare you for fun

score.high: Human Cat on a Hot Tin Roof  Electricity in your veins—one decibel and you’re airborne!
score.medium: Respectably Jumpy  You’ll flinch like a normal person, then laugh about it 2 seconds later.
score.low: Unflappable Zen Master  Nothing fazes you. You probably meditate during horror movies.
